sn12.40:1.2: “Mendicants, what you intend or plan, and what you have underlying tendencies for become a support for the continuation of consciousness.
sn12.40:1.3: When this support exists, consciousness becomes established.
sn12.40:1.4: When consciousness is established and grows, there is an inclination.
sn12.40:1.5: When there is an inclination, there is coming and going.
sn12.40:1.6: When there is coming and going, there is passing away and reappearing.
sn12.40:1.7: When there is passing away and reappearing, future rebirth, old age, and death come to be, as do sorrow, lamentation, pain, sadness, and distress.
sn12.40:1.8: That is how this entire mass of suffering originates.
sn12.40:2.1: If you don’t intend or plan, but still have underlying tendencies, this becomes a support for the continuation of consciousness.
sn12.40:2.2: When this support exists, consciousness becomes established.
sn12.40:2.3: When consciousness is established and grows, there is an inclination.
sn12.40:2.4: When there is an inclination, there is coming and going.
sn12.40:2.5: When there is coming and going, there is passing away and reappearing.
sn12.40:2.6: When there is passing away and reappearing, future rebirth, old age, and death come to be, as do sorrow, lamentation, pain, sadness, and distress.
sn12.40:2.7: That is how this entire mass of suffering originates.
sn12.40:3.1: If you don’t intend or plan or have underlying tendencies, this doesn’t become a support for the continuation of consciousness.
sn12.40:3.2: With no support, consciousness is not established.
sn12.40:3.3: When consciousness is not established and doesn’t grow, there’s no inclination.
sn12.40:3.4: When there’s no inclination, there’s no coming and going.
sn12.40:3.5: When there’s no coming and going, there’s no passing away and reappearing.
sn12.40:3.6: When there’s no passing away and reappearing, future rebirth, old age, and death cease, as do sorrow, lamentation, pain, sadness, and distress.
sn12.40:3.7: That is how this entire mass of suffering ceases.”
